website_summaries.verdict: A mild stability shoe in a sleek package good for daily running.
pros: Provides lightweight support and stability for those in need of mild correction
Design is flexible and cushioning is highly responsive
Available in an array of attractive colors including bright blue, and options with neon accents
cons: The fit is quite narrow and is not appropriate for wider feet

customer_reviews.title: I am a loyal Brooks Revenna customer, but these ...
customer_reviews.text: I am a loyal Brooks Revenna customer, but these shoes have really let me down. I have barely had enough time to break them in and they are already tearing apart. I have had them all of 10 days and I have only walked in them for a few of those days. Regardless of the limited workload, the right shoe has managed to tear near the top left hand side of the shoe (near the ankle). Where is the quality?
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Huge Brooks fan, but unfortunately not this model....
customer_reviews.text: Love the fit of these (have 2 pair)!! However, after owning for a month and half and only wearing sporadically, extremely disappointed with what appears to be a problem with this model. On the inside of the shoe near the last lace hole, the material is wearing away, looking as if you repeatedly rubbed it against something. It has happened on both shoes and on the other pair as well. These shoes are not cheap and truly expect them to last quite a while. Will be reaching out to Brooks as well.
customer_reviews.author: KB

customer_reviews.title: Great Arch Support!
customer_reviews.text: I have been dealing with plantar fasciitis for the past several months now. I have followed my podiatrist's regime of stretches, had cortisone injections, and ordered special inserts - all with limited relief. On my son-in-law's recommendation I ordered these particular shoes. I was a little hesitant at first because of the price but I am so glad I did. I could feel the arch support immediately and within a week the pain relief was in full force. Hopefully I am not being premature in my exuberant praise but as of now, 10 days after first putting them on, I am completely sold on them. My next podiatrist appointment should be my last for awhile!
customer_reviews.author: John Biltz

customer_reviews.title: Excellent.  Glad I did my research.
customer_reviews.text: I use them for running on a treadmill and lifting weights. Not the best for weights because of the soft upper that doesn't protect your toes, but I'm not bringing two pairs of shoes to the gym every day. They are the most comfortable sneakers I've ever worn. I also have crappy knees but I'm able to run with them without third-party inserts that I usually need to add cushioning. Probably going to get a second pair for when I beat these to death. Been using them 5-6 days a week for lifting and 2-3 for running (about 2 miles per session) and they're holding up very well.
customer_reviews.author: Steve M

customer_reviews.title: Before I was running with Nike air max which was a comfortable shoe but it's not for long distance runs
customer_reviews.text: My girlfriend introduced me to Brooks running shoes. Before I was running with Nike air max which was a comfortable shoe but it's not for long distance runs. I really like how comfortable the Brooks shoes are. I tried different types of Brooks and found the Ravenna brand was the best one for my gait pattern. Not only did they improve my runs but they are a great supportive shoe to wear at work also. I'm on my feet all day and having a comfortable shoe is very important.
customer_reviews.author: C. Hillman

customer_reviews.title: Great shoe, poor uppers.
customer_reviews.text: These shoes are the most comfortable shoes I have worn in a long time. I have pretty wide feet but these just fit like a glove. I would give them 5 stars without hesitation IF it wasn't for the poor uppers. I have logged less than 500 kilometers (300 miles) and the uppers are falling apart. This is unacceptable for a shoe that is on the far side of $100.00
customer_reviews.author: Hanno Stamm

customer_reviews.title: Great fit, light ride
customer_reviews.text: I've only been on one 6 mile run in these, but here's my first impression: The soul is a little stiff (which I expect to break in as I run more), but other wise, they are a winner right out of the gate. They felt really light, fit below my ankle bones just right (a lot of running shoes rub the outsides of my ankles), and my feet never felt like they were suffocating. I've come to expect a great shoe from Brooks and these deliver.
customer_reviews.author: Tulvan

customer_reviews.title: Good padding and wicking
customer_reviews.text: I've been wearing Experia for a number of years and they've been great, I still love them, but I'm working on my first half marathon and have been getting squishy feet above 8 miles. Read a review and decided to try these, the padding is thinner but holds up well and though my feet sweat a lot when running, I haven't had near as much with these socks. I really like them through two runs so far.
customer_reviews.author: David Barnes

customer_reviews.title: Great shoe! I like that this stability shoe is ...
customer_reviews.text: Great shoe! I like that this stability shoe is not as stiff as the GTS, which I think is a bit too firm. I do have a somewhat narrow foot and this shoe fits well. If you have a wide foot, I think this shoe might be a bit too tight. Otherwise the fit is exactly what I expected. Which means of course Brooks will change the next revision and it will be completely different.
customer_reviews.author: jkuhn

customer_reviews.title: great running shoe
customer_reviews.text: I like the bright colored patten and the sole is much better than the ravenna 6 model. I found the ravenna 6 model's sole to be very slippery but this one is feels normal. The only downside I've seen is that the tongue of the shoe slides to one side and doesn't always stay in place. I hope this problem goes away after a few weeks.
customer_reviews.author: piano_lover

customer_reviews.title: This shoe is coming apart
customer_reviews.text: This is a very comfortable shoe, it’s the second pair I’ve owned. Unfortunately both pairs have had the same problem. The mesh upper on the top of the shoe is disintegrating. I do not run in these shoes, they are used only for casual wear and are not abused in any way. The mesh is pulling apart and in both cases this began after about 3 months of wear. I’ve never seen this happen with any shoe. Not sure what’s going on but after this pair I need to look elsewhere.
customer_reviews.author: WSdH

customer_reviews.title: Great shoe!!
customer_reviews.text: The revenna 8 has been one of the single best shoes I have ever owned. I wore one pair for 2 years and it was still super comfortable. I put it to literally hell and back and it still holds up. My old ones are just very dirty so I bought these and they are amazing. I overpronate badly and these shoes are perfect for helping me. I'm a runner and hike and run trails these shoes have been in mud, trees, pools, lakes, eaten by dogs, and even slept in for the past 3years and they still feel great. They just look a bit rough 😂 Worth buying
customer_reviews.author: jeremy

customer_reviews.title: Great trainer for shorter runs
customer_reviews.text: This is a fairly good trainer. It is not cushioned as much as the Pegasus 34, so I use it for shorter runs of around 9 miles or less. I use the Pegasus 34 for my long runs of 11 miles or more. I run about 40 miles a week and like to use different shoes almost every day to avoid repetitive injuries.
customer_reviews.author: Too Tall

customer_reviews.title: Amazing running shoes!
customer_reviews.text: They are my go-to shoes when I run half and full marathons. They are extremely comfortable and provide a lot of support at the same time. Some of the other expensive shoes I tried before always ended up hurting my feet a bit after long runs. Those ones never do. Just perfect. I'll buy them again for sure once I'll wear out my old ones!
customer_reviews.author: Happy Place

customer_reviews.title: Very Unhappy with this shoe.
customer_reviews.text: There is a problem with the stitching in the left shoe. It rubs the top of my foot and caused a large bruise when running. I am unable to even wear them for everyday use. Loved the Ravenna 7. Sorry I bought the 8.
customer_reviews.author: jason Wools

customer_reviews.title: Awesome
customer_reviews.text: As with every pair of Brooks I've had, they're comfy, supportive (a bit more return than the adrenaline Brooks) and light. Perfect for my running style.
customer_reviews.author: darthlector

customer_reviews.title: Feels Great on the Foot...But Overall Just Okay
customer_reviews.text: Very comfortable shoe, however my Asics GT series shoes do appear to be a slightly better shoe for my overpronation. The shoe does seem to fit a little larger than an ASICS size 11 as well. Overall I really like the feel of the shoe on my foot but have so far been disappointed with the way the feel when I'm running. I am going to run with blue Superfeet in the shoe and if that improves the performance I'll write an update.
customer_reviews.author: NC Villain

customer_reviews.title: Brooks is consistent
customer_reviews.text: Brooks always designs great shoes that get more into the science than just the fashion of running. I moved on to the Ravenna from the Adrenaline because I wanted something lighter and it made a big difference. I highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Jonathan Pathuis

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable shoe that helped relieve my shin pain
customer_reviews.text: I bought these to replace some mizuno wave creations I had. I was having some shin pain with the old shoe's but these Brooks are great. I've done a few runs so far and my shin's are much better. I could tell a difference the very first run. They are as comfortable as the mizuno's, both were great in that department. The mizuno's were a 'neutral' shoe and the brooks 'stabilizing' which is what I needed apparently. Just for comparison I run 2-3 times a week and do about 3 miles each time.
customer_reviews.author: jacklin

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable and look good
customer_reviews.text: Comfortable shoes that feel like you’re barely wearing them. Worth the buy. So far so good. I use them for running and hiking.
customer_reviews.author: GreatBrandini

customer_reviews.title: Best shoe so far!
customer_reviews.text: I’ve always been a fan of Brooke’s, and a big fan of the ravennas. But these shoes are on another level! Out of the box they were the most comfortable shoe I’ve ever put on my feet, this company knows their clientele and makes a great durable shoe for the long distance runner
customer_reviews.author: Chris

customer_reviews.title: Great shoe for the price!
customer_reviews.text: Replaced my worn Glycerin 12s with these after using the guide on the Brooks site they're great. Feels like I'm gliding when I'm walking to the gym and when I'm running on the treadmill. Eventually I'll use them on road. The color scheme is nice, not too flashy so I'm wondering how good they would be for use at night.
customer_reviews.author: Pablo

customer_reviews.title: Good shoe!
customer_reviews.text: Good fit for overpronation. The gap in the lacing keeps pressure off of the arch as well. They help with correcting "form" when running
customer_reviews.author: DD

customer_reviews.title: great running and biking sneakers
customer_reviews.text: Great sneakers. A tiny bit heavy if you're used to Asics but not too bad. I've used them for running and biking and they fit the bill for both. I wouldn't use them for cross-training or aerobic exercises because there really isn't much horizontal give, but they're great for what they're designed for.
customer_reviews.author: Sam

customer_reviews.title: The Worst Running Shoe I Ever Purchased and the First Shoe I Donated to Goodwill
customer_reviews.text: I wanted to try a Brooks version and was very disappointed to the point I gave them to Goodwill. Everything about this shoe is too small/short... width, tongue, laces, just everything.
customer_reviews.author: Jake%56

customer_reviews.title: I liked the shoe
customer_reviews.text: I liked the shoe, but had issues with weird laces. I returned them and then you sent them back to me?????? I guess I 'll have to keep them.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: He suffers from occassional foot problems and these Brooks offer good support as well as comfort
customer_reviews.text: My husband loves these shoes! He suffers from occassional foot problems and these Brooks offer good support as well as comfort. He has both the green & this red color. The red is very nice looking.
customer_reviews.author: lynn

customer_reviews.title: sneak up on ya
customer_reviews.text: Fit comfortable- sometimes the tongue slides when I am running- not sure if it's shoe or way I RUN. BUT OVERALL THE SNEAKER IS COMFORTABLE AND HAS A NICE CUSHIONED BOTTOM
customer_reviews.author: Gwiz

customer_reviews.title: THIS DOES NOT FEEL LIKE THE RAVENNA 7 AT ALL
customer_reviews.text: RAVENNA 7 FANS DO NOT BUY THIS SNEAKER..JUST BUY THE RAVENNA 7!!!!!!! FELT COMPLETELY DIFFERENT IN REGARDS TO SUPPORT OF MY HEELS AND FIT. TOTAL LET DOWN...AGIAN JUST BUY THE RAVENNA 7 OR SWITCH MODELS COMPLETELY **I never post comments but felt the need to add my 2c to this one.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: So far a great shoe!
customer_reviews.text: Great shoes, as expected. The color was slightly darker than the picture, but overall very pleased with my purchase.
customer_reviews.author: R Waters

customer_reviews.title: I love brooks and especially the Ravenna series
customer_reviews.text: I love brooks and especially the Ravenna series. My last pair lasted twice as long as any other shoe I've had. I think the durability is not worth the price which is too high but close. It fits great... Overall very happy, they do seem soft, two months feel great and support is phenomenal. hope they can take a beating.... Especially for that steep of a price.
customer_reviews.author: TurtalStake

customer_reviews.title: Excellent quality but runs small.
customer_reviews.text: It was labeled an extra wide, but not. It seemed even to slim to be a regular! I liked the look and the quality, Brooks makes great shoes!
customer_reviews.author: Chez

customer_reviews.title: I love Brooks running shoes
customer_reviews.text: I love Brooks running shoes. Have been using them for years. Found this brand that fit my feet and I'll stay with them.
customer_reviews.author: Jose L. Candelario

customer_reviews.title: A sales person recommended these for my son at a shoe store for ...
customer_reviews.text: Bought these for my son, he is a runner. No shin splints when he wears these! A sales person recommended these for my son at a shoe store for runners and he will not run in any other shoe now.
customer_reviews.author: Alma R. Sandoval

customer_reviews.title: I have been using Brooks for 11 years. In the past, this exact model had arched sole. Now it has a flat sole and is not as good,
customer_reviews.text: I have been using Brooks for 11 years. In the past, this exact model had arched sole. Now it has a flat sole and is not as good, for me!
customer_reviews.author: epicurean

customer_reviews.title: ... wasn't convinced at the start of use these were better than my Brooks Ghosts but I have gotten use ...
customer_reviews.text: I wasn't convinced at the start of use these were better than my Brooks Ghosts but I have gotten use to them and they are now broken in. Very comfortable. Great support. No issues.
customer_reviews.author: JWCARLON

customer_reviews.title: This brand is the only one that a bone in ...
customer_reviews.text: This brand is the only one that a bone in the middle of my foot doesn't get out of wack with. Been wearing Brooks exclusively for over 10 years now.
customer_reviews.author: RolyatD

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: I like the shoes. Ordered them because my previous shoes were not available.
customer_reviews.author: Cindy L. Sutton

customer_reviews.title: It's like running on clouds
customer_reviews.text: The most comfortable shoe I've ever ran in. I took the runner's world survey to find the most compatible shoe for me and these shoes were first on the list. I bought them and can say they're worth every penny.
customer_reviews.author: Darry Luther

customer_reviews.title: It's always good to get a black
customer_reviews.text: It's always good to get a black, grey or some mix of the two colors in shoes as they will go with anything.
customer_reviews.author: lordoflies

customer_reviews.title: Great Shoe for Long Distance Running
customer_reviews.text: Great shoe, so much more comfortable than what I had before.
customer_reviews.author: kainor

customer_reviews.title: Incredibly comfortable shoe. At most
customer_reviews.text: Incredibly comfortable shoe. At most, I wear them twice a week, to work or to workout. I’m not a runner. Sadly, they’re falling apart.
customer_reviews.author: Hutch

customer_reviews.title: Great shoes
customer_reviews.text: My son loves these shoes. This is the third pair I’ve bought for him.
customer_reviews.author: Kate

customer_reviews.title: Second pair
customer_reviews.text: Bought these for my son. He loves them. This is his second pair.
customer_reviews.author: PMcG

customer_reviews.title: Good buy
customer_reviews.text: This is my first pair Brooks. I have only worn ASICS for some time but I after hearing much praise I decided to give Brooks a shot. The ravennas are apparently not top of the line for Brooks but I am very impressed.
customer_reviews.author: Mick

customer_reviews.title: Way to narrow
customer_reviews.text: Far too narrow in the toe. I went from the Glycerin 15 to this model and am going back to the Glycerin. I would not call this a D width shoe.
customer_reviews.author: J. Johnson

customer_reviews.title: but 5 stars because they broke in quick enough and now are super comfortable.
customer_reviews.text: They are a little tight at first, but 5 stars because they broke in quick enough and now are super comfortable.
customer_reviews.author: TheAlan

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: love these shoes they lasted about 3 months ie 600 hours easy.
customer_reviews.author: AARON

customer_reviews.title: Not durable
customer_reviews.text: This was my second pair of these. I really liked the first ones.But I’ve worn them twice and theres already a rear in the fabric by the ankle.
customer_reviews.author: Stephen R.

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: Wears good, but not the most comfortable running shoe for me..
customer_reviews.author: Steve A.

customer_reviews.title: Love the Brooks brand for running!
customer_reviews.text: Very good running shoe. It’s very comfortable. My flat feet require more arch support. I would look at another Brooks model for my flat feet.
customer_reviews.author: Oscar L. NYC

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Love these shoes. They look good and are very comfortable!
customer_reviews.author: Keith Frey

customer_reviews.title: Brooks Ravenna
customer_reviews.text: Love the Brooks Ravenna shoes and this is my first pair of Brooks and I will buy more when the need arises.
customer_reviews.author: Winky15

customer_reviews.title: Nice shoe and comfortable
customer_reviews.text: Nice shoe and comfortable. However, I've only put on about 200 miles and they are already starting to fall apart.
customer_reviews.author: E. Loge

customer_reviews.title: Great shoe!
customer_reviews.text: Nice shoe-fit as expected! Hubby got lots of good compliments on them!
customer_reviews.author: Misty

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Great Shoe!!! When I find something I like I stick with it. Great running shoe
customer_reviews.author: Abigail

customer_reviews.title: I like that they come in a 2E
customer_reviews.text: The only shoe I buy for my feet. I like that they come in a 2E.
customer_reviews.author: Jerry Christensen

customer_reviews.title: ... for about 6 years now and is still my favorite
customer_reviews.text: I’ve been using Ravennas for about 6 years now and is still my favorite shoe
customer_reviews.author: Julian

customer_reviews.title: Amazing shoes for a good price
customer_reviews.text: Great shoes, fit perfectly. Way cheaper than buying at a running store I highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: SethMJ

customer_reviews.title: Great shoe
customer_reviews.text: I have a pair that I got at the local mall and love them. I took a look to see if Amazon had them. They were not only available but the price was lower. Love the stability of the sneaker.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great fit and perfect size.
customer_reviews.text: Best shoes I’ve bought on Amazon. I run 5 times a week and usually buy much more pricing mizuno shoes, but these shoes fit the bill perfectly.
customer_reviews.author: c.jones

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Great shoe. Was have trouble with foot pain, but with these it is much better.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: One Star
customer_reviews.text: Lasted less than 2 months before getting holes in them.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Uncomfortable shoe
customer_reviews.text: Low in step, most uncomfortable shoe I’ve worn! Can’t wear all day!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: order 1/2 size down
customer_reviews.text: I wear a 10 in Asics and Nikes. Ordered a 10 in these and they're a little big. Would order a 1/2 size down if you wear a 10 in other brands like I do.
customer_reviews.author: Nate

customer_reviews.title: Poor quality
customer_reviews.text: Wore these shoes at most 6-8 times. Very disappointed in the construction and materials used on this shoe. Brooks is suppose to be a quality running shoe.
customer_reviews.author: Kenneth Booras

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Comfortable, Great support in the heel, but still lightweight. Good running shoe.
customer_reviews.author: Jordan Nash

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: My husband has plantar fasciitis and absolutely loves these shoes!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Move Over Nike & New Balance
customer_reviews.text: Best running shoe I've ever owned. Better late to the brand than never.
customer_reviews.author: Matt Bisceglia

customer_reviews.title: glad I did
customer_reviews.text: Be sure to read through a forum about the difference I sizing with this shoe brand, glad I did!
customer_reviews.author: Jared

customer_reviews.title: Real product
customer_reviews.text: I am not going to wear it because it's not a real product
customer_reviews.author: Yossi

customer_reviews.title: Awesome Upgrade!
customer_reviews.text: I made the transition from the ravenna 6 to the 8 somewhat blindly and was amazed at how much more comfortable these shoes were for long runs. The form and function of this model of shoe is far superior to the version 6. Love them!
customer_reviews.author: Nicholas B

customer_reviews.title: Size is not exact
customer_reviews.text: They are good for running or just daily wear, but they run a little big. I would say to get them in a half size smaller especially if you plan to run in them.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: looks great, not quite as comfortable feel as earlier versions ...
customer_reviews.text: Fits well, looks great, not quite as comfortable feel as earlier versions of this shoe seemed to be.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great shoes. I am pretty flat footed with a ...
customer_reviews.text: Great shoes.I am pretty flat footed with a slight overpronation - these provide the perfect amount of stability.
customer_reviews.author: CPA Richmond

customer_reviews.title: Happy Doc!!
customer_reviews.text: They feel great. I have not trained in them yet but worked a 13 hour day in my feet; they held up well
customer_reviews.author: Kimberly R. Pitts

customer_reviews.title: Narrow
customer_reviews.text: The shoe is narrower than my Ravenna 7 I own
customer_reviews.author: mark

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable
customer_reviews.text: New track runner. Purchased for HS track team. Very Comfortable wears everyday and everywhere.
customer_reviews.author: J

customer_reviews.title: Brooks really did a nice job on this version of the Ravenna
customer_reviews.text: Brooks really did a nice job on this version of the Ravenna. The Ravenna 7s were good, however, the 8s are excellent with some straps removed in the forefoot they are extremely comfortable out of the box. They also look good.
customer_reviews.author: A. Rausch

customer_reviews.title: Had an evaluation at a local high end shoes store and discovered that these would work best for my running style
customer_reviews.text: Just started running again. Had an evaluation at a local high end shoes store and discovered that these would work best for my running style. Ordered them on Amazon upon finding them 40% less than retail. I was a little baffled when they recommend that I purchase them a whole size larger than my normal shoe, but after getting them i understand why. I was worried about foot sliding around in shoe, but they fit great and provide the support I need.
customer_reviews.author: Mai John

customer_reviews.title: Awesome, but needs more colors
customer_reviews.text: I started running with Ravenna 5s a couple years ago. Since then I've tried a bunch of different brands and styles of running shoes but none of them feel as good as Ravennas. The Ravenna 8s are the best. They got rid of all those irritating seems. I wish they came in more colors. It's the only area that they are really behind in, and the only thing that even makes me ever want to try out other brands.
customer_reviews.author: Josiah R. Ferris

customer_reviews.title: They are a good pair, but I feel I like the L4 ...
customer_reviews.text: I got these in addition to the Revenna Launch 4. I got the 8's as my 'trail' shoe and the L4 as my 'road' shoe. As a previous Brooks Ravenna shoe wearer (this will be my 4th pair) I have to admit, the 8 is not quite a 'trail' shoe. They are a good pair, but I feel I like the L4 better.
customer_reviews.author: JPL

customer_reviews.title: Love them!
customer_reviews.text: I love my Brooks Ravenna 8's. I ran my first full marathon in them, and they took care of me! They hold up very well for a putting a lot of miles on them. I went ahead and ordered 2 more pairs to have as back ups!
customer_reviews.author: Fuzzy

customer_reviews.title: not sure what else to say
customer_reviews.text: The instep (top of my foot) gets sore quickly. Even with laces loose.
customer_reviews.author: H. Elaine Stumpf

customer_reviews.title: Too small, because the left shoe was a size ...
customer_reviews.text: Too small, because the left shoe was a size 11 and I ordered a 12. I had to return to amazon due to the mismatched sizes.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew J. Chase

customer_reviews.title: Worse pair of Brooks I've owned
customer_reviews.text: Not the best pair of Brooks. I use to love Brooks. My last 5-6 pairs over the past decade have been Brooks. But after this pair, I'm going to need rethink buying Brooks in the future
customer_reviews.author: Scott Wall

customer_reviews.title: Good
customer_reviews.text: Good shoe but I’m moving to a shoe with a carbon plate
customer_reviews.author: Farmape

product_meta.title: Brooks Men's Ravenna 8
product_meta.description: Now with an even more streamlined look and feel, the men's Ravenna 8 offers a springy ride thanks to responsive cushioning and updated design to make heel-to-toe transitions even easier so your feet move quickly and naturally from one stride to the next.
feature_bullets: BIOMOGO DNA MIDSOLE CUSHIONINGdynamically adapts to every step and stride
DIAGONAL ROLL BARguides the body back into its natural motion pattern
MIDFOOT TRANSITION ZONE AND SEGMENTED CRASH PADcreate fast heel-to-toe transitions
UPDATED FOREFOOTblown rubber enables extra-springy toe-off
ADJUSTABLE SADDLEpulls from the heel to wrap the midfoot in a secure fit
